content:
• Friday, July 15, 2011
  • CLX

    Chris Stuart questions whether Clorox (CLX +8.9%) is really worth $100/share, as Carl Icahn...

    Chris Stuart questions whether Clorox (CLX +8.9%) is really worth $100/share, as Carl Icahn claims it would be to a potential acquirer such PG,  UL, CL, or KMB. At $100, Clorox, which recently forecast FY2012 growth of just 1-3%, would trade at nearly 25x its estimated FY2012 EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM) finishes the day -12% after reporting a 4Q loss on reduction in...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM) finishes the day -12% after reporting a 4Q loss on reduction in government contract revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • CBPO

    China Biologic Products (CBPO -6.5%) takes a hit today after receiving notification from the...

    China Biologic Products (CBPO -6.5%) takes a hit today after receiving notification from the Guizhou Provincial Health Department that the government has suspended the company's blood collection activities in the province. The suspension affects four of six collection sites it runs, and the impact upon current business operations could be significant.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • BHP

    One small energy company benefiting from BHP's  acquisition of Petrohawk (HK +62%) today is...

    One small energy company benefiting from BHP's  acquisition of Petrohawk (HK +62%) today is Crimson Expoloration (CXPO +14%). The company operates in the same onshore Gulf Coast regions as Petrohawk, and is also a player, albeit minor, in the in the enormous Eagle Ford shale oilfields.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • AIBYY

    Allied Irish Bank (AIB +22%) and Bank of Ireland (IRE +38%) are soaring in the wake of the...

    Allied Irish Bank (AIB +22%) and Bank of Ireland (IRE +38%) are soaring in the wake of the European stress tests. The report confirms the banks exceed their capital ratio thresholds, showing a significant capital surplus for each in both the base and stress scenarios.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • GHL

    Greenhill (NYSE:GHL) is down 10.3% on the news that managing director Timothy M. George is...

    Greenhill (NYSE:GHL) is down 10.3% on the news that managing director Timothy M. George is leaving for Lazard (NYSE:LAZ). George is the third managing director Greenhill has lost since early June, after averaging less than one such departure per year since 1996.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • OPEN

    Shares of OpenTable (OPEN +4.2%) right the ship after losing 9.2% in two days, spurred on by a...

    Shares of OpenTable (OPEN +4.2%) right the ship after losing 9.2% in two days, spurred on by a Neutral rating from Janney.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy (SWN +8%) issues a statement expressing support for a hydraulic fracturing...

    Southwestern Energy (SWN +8%) issues a statement expressing support for a hydraulic fracturing disclosure bill signed into law by Texas Governor Rick Perry. The law requires public disclosure of all the chemicals contained in hydraulic fracturing fluids. The stock is up today on the back of BHP's (BHP -1.3%) acquisition of Petrohawk (HK +63%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • PCXCQ

    Shares of coal companies gain after Patriot Coal receives an upgrade, and Argus releases a...

    Shares of coal companies gain after Patriot Coal receives an upgrade, and Argus releases a positive industry report. Gainers: PCX +6.4%, LLEN +3.1%, CNX +3.1%, ACI +2.9%, BTU +2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • MHRCQ

    Oil and gas explorer Magnum Hunter (MHR +5.8%) gains after announcing mid-year production...

    Oil and gas explorer Magnum Hunter (MHR +5.8%) gains after announcing mid-year production results. The company says reserves are up 133% from year end, with about 90% of that growth tracing back to its April acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM

  • Lucas Energy (LEI +7%) holds on to gains after announcing solid gross production numbers for...

    Lucas Energy (LEI +7%) holds on to gains after announcing solid gross production numbers for May. The company adds that new drilling programs at its Rainey, Austin Chalk and Eagle Ford units will likely result in better-than-expected output for the remainder of FY2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • FNSR

    Finisar (FNSR +1.8%) bounces after Jefferies initiates with a buy on valuation, citing strong...

    Finisar (FNSR +1.8%) bounces after Jefferies initiates with a buy on valuation, citing strong underlying demand for the company's optical systems, ROADMs and fiber cabling.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • FLIR

    The bad news continues for FLIR Systems (FLIR -10.1%) after Morgan Keegan downgrades to Market...

    The bad news continues for FLIR Systems (FLIR -10.1%) after Morgan Keegan downgrades to Market Perform, and says it sees risk due to weakness in the defense industry. The firm issued downward guidance yesterday, contributing to shares standing as the biggest loser in the S&P 500 for the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • ATW

    Jefferies upgrades the oil service sector today, saying the offshore drilling cycle is finally...

    Jefferies upgrades the oil service sector today, saying the offshore drilling cycle is finally starting to show signs of "moving beyond a simple demand recovery and closer to one featuring real, albeit modest, pricing power." The firm raises Atwood Oceanics (ATW +3.8%), Noble (NE +2.8%) and Transocean (RIG +3.1%) to buy, and reiterates Rowan (RDC +1%) and Ensco (ESV +2.1%) as its top picks.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • GOOG

    Piper Jaffray is far from the only firm praising Google (GOOG +12.1%) following a stellar Q2....

    Piper Jaffray is far from the only firm praising Google (GOOG +12.1%) following a stellar Q2. JPMorgan gushes over surging international growth, and calls Google "a more focused company" under Larry Page; and Barclays belives the success of non-core businesses is bringing back Google's reputation as a growth stock. (PR) (CC transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • PCXCQ

    Patriot Coal (PCX +5.3%) pops after BMO upgrades the stock on improving macro conditions for...

    Patriot Coal (PCX +5.3%) pops after BMO upgrades the stock on improving macro conditions for coal producers. The firm says metallurgical coal prices should rise due to three factors: strong China-led demand, supply disruptions and cost-push inflation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • CLX

    The Street seems skeptical about Carl Icahn's intentions in his $76.50/share bid for Clorox...

    The Street seems skeptical about Carl Icahn's intentions in his $76.50/share bid for Clorox (NYSE:CLX), as shares that had traded near the offer price premarket are now only +7.2% at ~$73.40. Investors may be questioning whether Icahn merely wants to boost the price of the stock, of which he owns 9.4%, or whether he is really serious about getting a deal done.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • SM

    SM Energy (SM +7.5%) jumps after Wells Fargo ups it to Outperform on valuation. The firm says...

    SM Energy (SM +7.5%) jumps after Wells Fargo ups it to Outperform on valuation. The firm says the stock is trading at a 19% discount to NAV, and with the "funding hangover" off the Eagle Ford transactions the company should benefit from improved margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • BHP

    BHP's (BHP -1.5%) willingness to pay a 65% premium for Petrohawk (HK +62.7%) shows that mining...

    BHP's (BHP -1.5%) willingness to pay a 65% premium for Petrohawk (HK +62.7%) shows that mining companies will pay top dollar for natural gas plays (UNG +2.5%), despite the stubbornly low price of the commodity itself. JPMorgan's Mark Lear says acquisition targets could include: RRC +6.6%, BEXP +6.1%, KOG +5.7%. Also surging: COG +7%, CHK +6.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 3 Comments
  • DMND

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND -1.8%) drop after Deutsche downgrades to Hold from Buy.The firm...

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND -1.8%) drop after Deutsche downgrades to Hold from Buy.The firm says it lowers its opinion, but maintains the price target and EPS estimates for the firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • ARTNA

    Artesian Resources (ARTNA -4.4%) trades lower after pricing its 800K secondary offering at a...

    Artesian Resources (ARTNA -4.4%) trades lower after pricing its 800K secondary offering at a 3.3% discount to Thursday's close. The company plans to use the proceeds to fund a paid-in capital contribution to its Artesian Water subsidiary, which will repay its debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • DCTH

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH -10%) takes a hit this morning after announcing a 5M share secondary...

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH -10%) takes a hit this morning after announcing a 5M share secondary offering late yesterday. The company plans to use the proceeds for various purposes, including commercialization of products, obtaining regulatory approvals and funding of clinical trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • GOOG

    Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) scorching hot Q2 earnings show that its stock is a bargain hiding in...

    Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) scorching hot Q2 earnings show that its stock is a bargain hiding in plain sight, Heard On The Street writes. Even with an 11.5% surge in the opening minutes today, Google's shares, when net cash of $107/share is excluded, are trading at only ~16x expected 2011 earnings, and are still below where they started the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • VICL

    Biopharmaceutical researcher Vical (VICL +7%) says it will get a $130M upfront payment from...

    Biopharmaceutical researcher Vical (VICL +7%) says it will get a $130M upfront payment from Japan's Astellas Pharma (OTCPK:ALPMY) in a new licensing deal to develop and sell its TransVax vaccine.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • SGEN

    An FDA advisory panel backs approval of Seattle Genetics' (NASDAQ:SGEN) Hodgkin lymphoma...

    An FDA advisory panel backs approval of Seattle Genetics' (NASDAQ:SGEN) Hodgkin lymphoma treatment, but says it has not yet reached agreement on the type of confirmatory studies needed before accelerated approval can be granted, making it unclear if the Aug. 30 approval deadline will be met. SGEN -6.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • CY

    Capstone downgrades Cypress Semiconductor (NASDAQ:CY) to Hold based on valuation. From a...

    Capstone downgrades Cypress Semiconductor (NASDAQ:CY) to Hold based on valuation. From a technical perspective, the stock has failed three times this year at breaking through key resistance at $24, leaving it vulnerable to selling pressure over the near-term. Shares -1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • QLIK

    Qlik Technologies (QLIK -4.5%) slides premarket after Jefferies downgrades to Hold, reducing...

    Qlik Technologies (QLIK -4.5%) slides premarket after Jefferies downgrades to Hold, reducing price target to $34 from $39. New channel checks raise a "yellow flag" over deal slippage, and firm is also concerned about yesterday's change in Americas sales leadership, leading to a less attractive risk/reward ratio.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN) shares have fallen 9.2% in the last two days, after Benchmark lowered...

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN) shares have fallen 9.2% in the last two days, after Benchmark lowered its FQ2 revenue estimates on the belief that OpenTable's core reservations business is facing more competition, and that its deals service is struggling. Recent data from Alexa and Google Trends has raised the possibility of slowing growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • C

    Citigroup (NYSE:C) remains on track to meet Basel III requirements and reward investors with...

    Citigroup (NYSE:C) remains on track to meet Basel III requirements and reward investors with dividends and share buy-backs. The firm's CFO says it expects to return capital to shareholders next year, and stay within its target Tier 1 Common Capital Ratio. Shares +3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • HK

    Premarket gainers: HK +63%. GOOG +13%. CLX +11%. VICL +10%. LNG +6%. CHK +6%. MAT +5%. FST +5%....

    Premarket gainers: HK +63%. GOOG +13%. CLX +11%. VICL +10%. LNG +6%. CHK +6%. MAT +5%. FST +5%. SD +4%. XCO +4%. RENN +4%. EOG +4%. SINA +3%. YOKU +3%. CTIC +3%. BIDU +3%. JVA +3%. C +3%.
    Losers: OTC:DCTH -12%. SGEN -7%. QLIK -6%. GEL -4%. RAH -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • HK

    Oil-and-gas takes the pole among premarket gainers following Petrohawk's (HK +63%) $12.1B bid...

    Oil-and-gas takes the pole among premarket gainers following Petrohawk's (HK +63%) $12.1B bid from BHP Billiton (BHP -1.6%) as it moves deeper into the U.S. shale. The deal values HK at 50% higher than 30-day prices. LNG +6.2%. CHK +5.6%. FST +4.7%. SD +4.2%. XCO +3.8%. EOG +3.7%. HES +2.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • HK

    Shares of Petrohawk (NYSE:HK) surge after BHP Billiton (NYSE:BHP) agrees to buy the firm....

    Shares of Petrohawk (NYSE:HK) surge after BHP Billiton (NYSE:BHP) agrees to buy the firm. Analysts at Citi and KeyBank set a Hold rating for the firm after last night's announcement, and raised price targets. Shares +61% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • RECN

    Resources Connection (NASDAQ:RECN) Q4 profit more than doubled as the company reported strong...

    Resources Connection (NASDAQ:RECN) Q4 profit more than doubled as the company reported strong growth abroad and slightly higher revenue in the U.S. Revenue climbed 9% Y/Y to $145M from $133M, vs. analysts expectations of 146M. Shares +6.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • EXTR

    Struggling Ethernet switch vendor Extreme Networks (NASDAQ:EXTR) plans to slash 16% of its...

    Struggling Ethernet switch vendor Extreme Networks (NASDAQ:EXTR) plans to slash 16% of its workforce, with the goal of achieving "consistent double digit operating income." The company is also preannouncing FQ4 revenues will be above prior guidance, but that non-GAAP EPS will fall short. Shares +2.7% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • DXBGF

    Belgian lender Dexia (OTC:DXBGF) files suit against Deutsche Bank (DB -0.8%) over more than $1B...

    Belgian lender Dexia (OTC:DXBGF) files suit against Deutsche Bank (DB -0.8%) over more than $1B in losses from residential mortgage-backed securities. The lawsuit alleges fraud and claims Deutsche made "materially false and misleading statements."
     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 AM
  • CLX

    Carl Icahn offers to buy the rest of Clorox (NYSE:CLX) (he already owns 9.4%) for $76.50/share...

    Carl Icahn offers to buy the rest of Clorox (NYSE:CLX) (he already owns 9.4%) for $76.50/share (Thur. close: $68.43), or $12.6B. Of that, $7.8B would be funded by Jefferies Group (NYSE:JEF) at about 6.5%, and the rest would be cash and the shares it owns. If CLX accepts the offer by July 29, Icahn will pay $100M if the deal fails to close.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 AM
